intro: Gossypianthus mollis, commonly known as the woolly pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae and is often grown as an ornamental due to its unique appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Gossypianthus mollis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
